Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge breached procedural fairness by failing to specify a deadline for additional documentation
Application_Facts: Applicants were given time to provide evidence but failed to do so within an implied 20-day period
Decision_Outcome: Appeal dismissed; original decision upholding rejection of citizenship application upheld
Remedy_Requested: Court intervention to overturn Citizenship Judge's decision
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship Judge proceeded with decision based on available evidence without extending explicit deadline
Legal_Standard: Balance of probabilities to prove residency
Procedural_Issue: Failure to specify deadline for submission of additional documentation
Evidence_Used: Available documentary evidence submitted by applicants
Application_Basis: Proof of residency requirement for citizenship
Governing_Rule: Applicants must prove residency under section 5(1)(c); decisions to be made within 60 days
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of residency provided within reasonable time
Harm_Assessment: No harm found due to adherence to procedural fairness
Cause_Description: Insufficient proof of residency as required under the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Handling: Judge relied on evidence available after implied 20-day period expired
Evidence_Issues: Failure to submit sufficient residency documentation in timely manner
Evidence_Assessment: Based on balance of probabilities standard
Decision_Rationale: Judge acted within procedural standards; no obligation to set explicit deadline; decision based on available evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Incomplete or insufficient documentation provided by applicants
